head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #16

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #16 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on Board the Schooner Nancy in the month of September 1813 whilst at Makinac on her passage to Makinac from St Josephs[.]

p.span: Hauled along side the wharf & commenced unloading at 4 PM all out, fresh breezes from the SW all day & very warm[.]

div.p: on board, bound for Makinac With goods, filled away again & stood out for the Lake light winds & changeable, at 9 AM wind West & moderate, all sail set – at noon wind WNW, starboard tacks aboard, at 4 PM less wind at 6 calm ½ past 6 larboard tacks aboard wind WSW & light, clear weather at 8 wind WNW & freshens all sail set, tried the pump makes no water, at 10 wind West starboard tacks aboard, latter part of the night moderate winds all sail set[.]

Fore part of this 24 hours clear weather & moderate breezes at WNW & all sail set, beat up for Makinac at 4 AM light airs at WSW, at 8 hoisted the boat out, calm, towed, gained about 4 miles, when the wind freshened from the same quarter hung the boat in the tackles at noon Makinac distant about 9 miles at 6 PM calm towed again at 8 wind SE & light at 10 came too in ¼ less 3 fathom water with the best bower, handed all sail & set the watch[.]

Fore part of this fresh breezes at NE & disagreeable rainy weather, afternoon clears up & partial airs from the westwards, discharged some lumber for Crawford & Askin – no Boat comes for Government property[.]

Fore part of this day busily employed turning out Government property, consisting of 4 ps ordinance & Barrack stores, waited on Capt Bullock to let him know that I should be ready to sail this evening, to which he replyed that his letters were not ready, & that I should

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
